verses.verse: Flee <S%H5756><s%> for safety <S%H1121><s%>, ye children of Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>, out of the midst <S%H7130><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, and blow <S%H8628><s%> the trumpet <S%H7782><s%> in Tekoa <S%H8620><s%>, and raise up <S%H5375><s%> a signal <S%H4864><s%> on Beth-haccherem <S%H1021><s%>; for evil <S%H7451><s%> looketh <S%H8259><s%> forth from the north <S%H6828><s%>, and a great <S%H1419><s%> destruction <S%H7667><s%>.
The <S%H1820><s%> comely <S%H5116><s%> and delicate <S%H6026><s%> one <S%H1323><s%>, the daughter of Zion <S%H6726><s%>, will I cut off.

Shepherds <S%H7462><s%> with their flocks <S%H5739><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> unto her <S%H8628><s%>; they shall pitch their tents <S%H168><s%> against her round about <S%H5439><s%>; they shall feed <S%H7462><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> in his place <S%H3027><s%>.

Prepare <S%H6942><s%> ye war <S%H4421><s%> against her <S%H6965><s%>; arise, and let us go up <S%H5927><s%> at noon <S%H6672><s%>. Woe <S%H188><s%> unto us <S%H3117><s%>! for the day declineth <S%H6437><s%>, for the shadows <S%H6752><s%> of the evening <S%H6153><s%> are stretched out <S%H5186><s%>.
Arise <S%H6965><s%>, and let us go <S%H5927><s%> up by night <S%H3915><s%>, and let us destroy <S%H7843><s%> her palaces <S%H759><s%>.

For thus hath Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Hew ye down <S%H3772><s%> trees <S%H6097><s%>, and cast <S%H8210><s%> up a mound <S%H5550><s%> against Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>: this is the city <S%H5892><s%> to be visited <S%H6485><s%>; she is wholly oppression <S%H6233><s%> in the midst of her <S%H7130><s%>.

As a well <S%H953><s%> casteth forth <S%H6979><s%> its waters <S%H4325><s%>, so she casteth forth <S%H6979><s%> her wickedness <S%H7451><s%>: violence <S%H2555><s%> and destruction <S%H7701><s%> is heard <S%H8085><s%> in her <S%H6440><s%>; before me continually <S%H8548><s%> is sickness <S%H2483><s%> and wounds <S%H4347><s%>.

Be thou instructed <S%H3256><s%>, O Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>, lest my soul <S%H5315><s%> be alienated <S%H3363><s%> from thee <S%H7760><s%>; lest I make thee a desolation <S%H8077><s%>, a land <S%H776><s%> not inhabited <S%H3427><s%>.

Thus saith <S%H559><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, They shall thoroughly <S%H5953><s%> glean <S%H5953><s%> the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> as a vine <S%H1612><s%>: turn again <S%H7725><s%> thy hand <S%H3027><s%> as a grape-gatherer <S%H1219><s%> into the baskets <S%H5552><s%>.

To whom shall I speak <S%H1696><s%> and testify <S%H1696><s%>, that they may hear <S%H8085><s%>? behold <S%H241><s%>, their ear is uncircumcised <S%H6189><s%>, and they cannot <S%H3201><s%> hearken <S%H7181><s%>: behold <S%H1697><s%>, the word of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is become unto them a reproach <S%H2781><s%>; they have no delight in it <S%H2654><s%>.

Therefore I am full <S%H4392><s%> of the wrath <S%H2534><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; I am weary <S%H3811><s%> with holding in <S%H3557><s%>: pour it out <S%H8210><s%> upon the children <S%H5768><s%> in the street <S%H2351><s%>, and upon the assembly <S%H5475><s%> of young men <S%H970><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>; for even the husband <S%H376><s%> with the wife <S%H802><s%> shall be taken <S%H3920><s%>, the aged <S%H2205><s%> with him that is full <S%H4390><s%> of days <S%H3117><s%>.

And their houses <S%H1004><s%> shall be turned <S%H5437><s%> unto others <S%H312><s%>, their fields <S%H7704><s%> and their wives <S%H802><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>; for I will stretch out <S%H5186><s%> my hand <S%H3027><s%> upon the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, saith <S%H5002><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

For from the least <S%H6996><s%> of them even unto the greatest <S%H1419><s%> of them every one is given <S%H1214><s%> to covetousness <S%H1215><s%>; and from the prophet <S%H5030><s%> even unto the priest <S%H3548><s%> every one dealeth <S%H6213><s%> falsely <S%H8267><s%>.

They have healed <S%H7495><s%> also the hurt <S%H7667><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> slightly <S%H7043><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Peace <S%H7965><s%>, peace <S%H7965><s%>; when there is no peace <S%H7965><s%>.

Were they ashamed <S%H3001><s%> when they had committed <S%H6213><s%> abomination <S%H8441><s%>? nay <S%H1571><s%>, they were not at all <S%H954><s%> ashamed <S%H954><s%>, neither <S%H1571><s%> could <S%H3045><s%> they blush <S%H3637><s%>: therefore they shall fall <S%H5307><s%> among them that fall <S%H5307><s%>; at the time <S%H6256><s%> that I visit <S%H6485><s%> them they shall be cast down <S%H3782><s%>, saith <S%H559><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

Thus saith <S%H559><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, Stand <S%H5975><s%> ye in the ways <S%H1870><s%> and see <S%H7200><s%>, and ask <S%H7592><s%> for the old <S%H5769><s%> paths <S%H5410><s%>, where is the good <S%H2896><s%> way <S%H1870><s%>; and walk <S%H3212><s%> therein <S%H4672><s%>, and ye shall find rest <S%H4771><s%> for your souls <S%H5315><s%>: but they said <S%H559><s%>, We will not walk therein <S%H3212><s%>.

And I set <S%H6965><s%> watchmen <S%H6822><s%> over you <S%H7181><s%>, saying, Hearken to the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the trumpet <S%H7782><s%>; but they said <S%H559><s%>, We will not hearken <S%H7181><s%>.
Therefore hear <S%H8085><s%>, ye nations <S%H1471><s%>, and know <S%H3045><s%>, O congregation <S%H5712><s%>, what is among them.

Hear <S%H8085><s%>, O earth <S%H776><s%>: behold <S%H935><s%>, I will bring evil <S%H7451><s%> upon this people <S%H5971><s%>, even the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of their thoughts <S%H4284><s%>, because they have not hearkened <S%H7181><s%> unto my words <S%H1697><s%>; and as for my law <S%H8451><s%>, they have rejected it <S%H3988><s%>.

To what purpose cometh <S%H935><s%> there to me frankincense <S%H3828><s%> from Sheba <S%H7614><s%>, and the sweet <S%H2896><s%> cane <S%H7070><s%> from a far <S%H4801><s%> country <S%H776><s%>? your burnt-offerings <S%H5930><s%> are not acceptable <S%H7522><s%>, nor your sacrifices <S%H2077><s%> pleasing unto me <S%H6149><s%>.

Therefore thus saith <S%H559><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, Behold <S%H5414><s%>, I will lay stumbling-blocks <S%H4383><s%> before this people <S%H5971><s%>; and the fathers <S%H1><s%> and the sons <S%H1121><s%> together <S%H3162><s%> shall stumble <S%H3782><s%> against them <S%H7934><s%>; the neighbor and his friend <S%H7453><s%> shall perish <S%H6><s%>.

Thus saith <S%H559><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, Behold <S%H5971><s%>, a people cometh <S%H935><s%> from the north <S%H6828><s%> country <S%H776><s%>; and a great <S%H1419><s%> nation <S%H1471><s%> shall be stirred <S%H5782><s%> up from the uttermost parts <S%H3411><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

They lay hold <S%H2388><s%> on bow <S%H7198><s%> and spear <S%H3591><s%>; they are cruel <S%H394><s%>, and have no mercy <S%H7355><s%>; their voice <S%H6963><s%> roareth <S%H1993><s%> like the sea <S%H3220><s%>, and they ride <S%H7392><s%> upon horses <S%H5483><s%>, every one set in array <S%H6186><s%>, as a man <S%H376><s%> to the battle <S%H4421><s%>, against thee <S%H1323><s%>, O daughter of Zion <S%H6726><s%>.

We have heard <S%H8085><s%> the report <S%H8089><s%> thereof <S%H3027><s%>; our hands wax feeble <S%H7503><s%>: anguish <S%H6869><s%> hath taken hold <S%H2388><s%> of us <S%H2427><s%>, and pangs as of a woman in travail <S%H3205><s%>.

Go not forth <S%H3318><s%> into the field <S%H7704><s%>, nor walk <S%H3212><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%>; for the sword <S%H2719><s%> of the enemy <S%H341><s%>, and terror <S%H4032><s%>, are on every side <S%H5439><s%>.

O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%>, gird <S%H2296><s%> thee with sackcloth <S%H8242><s%>, and wallow <S%H6428><s%> thyself in ashes <S%H665><s%>: make <S%H6213><s%> thee mourning <S%H60><s%>, as for an only son <S%H3173><s%>, most bitter <S%H8563><s%> lamentation <S%H4553><s%>; for the destroyer <S%H7703><s%> shall suddenly <S%H6597><s%> come upon us <S%H935><s%>.
I have made <S%H5414><s%> thee a trier <S%H969><s%> and a fortress <S%H4013><s%> among my people <S%H5971><s%>; that thou mayest know <S%H3045><s%> and try <S%H974><s%> their way <S%H1870><s%>.

They are all grievous <S%H5493><s%> revolters <S%H5637><s%>, going <S%H1980><s%> about with slanders <S%H7400><s%>; they are brass <S%H5178><s%> and iron <S%H1270><s%>: they all of them deal corruptly <S%H7843><s%>.

The bellows <S%H4647><s%> blow fiercely <S%H2787><s%>; the lead <S%H5777><s%> is consumed <S%H8552><s%> of the fire <S%H800><s%>: in vain <S%H7723><s%> do they go <S%H6884><s%> on refining <S%H6884><s%>; for the wicked <S%H7451><s%> are not plucked away <S%H5423><s%>.
Refuse <S%H3988><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> shall men call <S%H7121><s%> them <S%H3068><s%>, because Jehovah hath rejected them <S%H3988><s%>.
